newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swissair cargo looks to fully use Brussels.
newsitem.headline: Swissair cargo looks to fully use Brussels.

text.p: Swissair AG and Sabena are exploring ways to take full advantage of Brussels airport's free cargo capacity to improve their services, a Swissair spokesman said.
Compared with Swissair's home base of Zurich airport, Brussels airport is less congested and has unused cargo handling and warehouse capacity.
"We are looking at possibilities of exploring Brussels' free cargo capacity," the spokesman said.
Swissair, which has a 49.5 percent stake in Sabena, could for example use this capacity to deliver goods to customers in Europe much faster.
"We will now have an alternative cargo site and other opportunities to direct our cargo," the spokesman said.
Earlier Swissair said it would start marketing the cargo capacity of Sabena from January 1, 1997.
